alert.note: Alert for Dodge (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 11:46PM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Mills, western Pottawattamie, northern Sarpy, southern Washington, southeastern Dodge, Douglas and northeastern Saunders Counties through 100 AM CDT... At 1142 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 3 miles west of Leshara, or 8 miles south of Fremont, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Valley and Yutan around 1150 PM CDT. Elkhorn and Waterloo around 1200 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Bennington, Omaha, Gretna, Flanagan Lake, Zorinsky Lake, Boys Town, Millard, Standing Bear Lake, Chalco, Wehrspann Lake, Prairie Queen Recreation Area, Ralston, Aksarben, Benson, Papillion, La Vista, Midtown, Florence, Carter Lake, Eppley Airfield, Bellevue, and Council Bluffs. This includes the following highways... Interstate 29 between mile markers 39 and 72. Interstate 80 in Iowa between mile markers 1 and 11. Interstate 80 in Nebraska between mile markers 437 and 454. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
